title: Shoulder Press
description: A shoulder press is a weight training exercise in which a weight is pressed straight upwards from the shoulders, typically using dumbbells or a barbell.

title: Bicep Curl
description: A bicep curl usually starts with the arm in a fully extended position, holding a weight with a supinated (palms facing up) grip. A full repetition consists of bending or 'curling' the elbow until it is fully flexed, then slowly lowering the weight to the starting position.

title: Leg Press
description: The leg press is a compound weight training exercise in which the individual pushes a weight or resistance away from them using their legs. It targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

title: Push-up
description: A push-up is a common bodyweight exercise in which a person lowers their body to the ground and then pushes it back up. It primarily works the chest, shoulders, and triceps.

title: Deadlift
description: The deadlift is a weight training exercise in which a loaded barbell or bar is lifted off the ground to the level of the hips, then lowered back to the ground.

title: Plank
description: The plank is an isometric core strength exercise that involves maintaining a position similar to a push-up for an extended period, with the body held in a straight line from head to heels.

title: Lat Pulldown
description: The lat pulldown is a strength training exercise that targets the upper back. It involves pulling a bar or handle attachment down to the upper chest or behind the neck.

title: Squat
description: The squat is a lower body exercise that involves the muscles of the thighs, hips, and buttocks. It is a fundamental movement for building strength in the legs.

title: Tricep Dip
description: Tricep dips are a bodyweight exercise that targets the triceps. It involves lowering and raising the body by bending and straightening the arms.

title: Chest Fly
description: The chest fly is a strength training exercise that works the chest muscles. It is typically performed using dumbbells or a machine.

title: Hammer Curl
description: Hammer curls are a variation of the bicep curl that targets the brachialis muscle. The exercise involves a neutral grip with the palms facing each other.

title: Lunges
description: Lunges are a lower body exercise that involves stepping forward with one leg and lowering the body until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle.

title: Seated Row
description: The seated row is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the upper back. It involves pulling a handle toward the body while seated.

title: Burpees
description: Burpees are a full-body exercise that combines squats, push-ups, and jumps. It is an excellent cardiovascular and strength-building exercise.

title: Reverse Crunch
description: The reverse crunch is an abdominal exercise that targets the lower abdominal muscles. It involves lifting the hips off the ground toward the chest.

title: Calf Raise
description: Calf raises are an isolation exercise for the calves. It involves lifting the heels off the ground to work the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles.

title: Front Squat
description: The front squat is a variation of the squat that involves holding the barbell in front of the shoulders. It places more emphasis on the quadriceps.

title: Pull-up
description: A pull-up is an upper-body exercise that targets the muscles of the back, particularly the latissimus dorsi. It involves lifting the body using an overhead bar.

title: Russian Twist
description: The Russian twist is an abdominal exercise that involves twisting the torso from side to side while holding a weight or using bodyweight for resistance.

title: Leg Curl
description: The leg curl is a machine-based exercise that targets the hamstrings. It involves curling the legs toward the buttocks against resistance.

title: Mountain Climbers
description: Mountain climbers are a dynamic full-body exercise that involves bringing the knees toward the chest in a running motion. It is excellent for cardio and core strength.

title: Skull Crushers
description: Skull crushers, or lying tricep extensions, are a weight training exercise that targets the triceps. It involves lowering the weight toward the forehead and extending the arms.

title: Box Jumps
description: Box jumps are a plyometric exercise that involves jumping onto a box or platform. It works the muscles of the legs and improves explosive power.

title: Hanging Leg Raise
description: The hanging leg raise is an advanced abdominal exercise that involves hanging from a bar and lifting the legs toward the chest. It targets the lower abs.

title: Arnold Press
description: The Arnold press is a shoulder exercise that involves a twisting motion during the lift. It targets the front and side delts, as well as the trapezius.

title: Dumbbell Row
description: The dumbbell row is a back exercise that involves bending at the hips and pulling a dumbbell toward the hip. It targets the lats and rhomboids.

title: Side Plank
description: The side plank is an isometric exercise that targets the muscles of the core, particularly the obliques. It involves supporting the body on one forearm and the side of the foot.

title: Step-ups
description: Step-ups are a lower body exercise that involves stepping onto a raised platform. It targets the muscles of the legs and glutes.

title: Incline Bench Press
description: The incline bench press is a variation of the bench press that targets the upper chest. It involves pressing a weight while on an inclined bench.

title: Face Pulls
description: Face pulls are a shoulder exercise that targets the rear delts and upper traps. It involves pulling a cable attachment toward the face.

title: Leg Extension
description: The leg extension is a machine-based exercise that targets the quadriceps. It involves extending the legs against resistance.

title: Dips
description: Dips are a compound exercise that targets the chest, triceps, and shoulders. It involves lowering and raising the body using parallel bars.

title: Kettlebell Swing
description: The kettlebell swing is a dynamic full-body exercise that involves swinging a kettlebell between the legs and up to chest height. It targets the hips, glutes, and core.

title: Romanian Deadlift
description: The Romanian deadlift is a variation of the deadlift that involves hinging at the hips and lowering the barbell while keeping the legs relatively straight. It targets the hamstrings and glutes.

title: Reverse Fly
description: The reverse fly is a back exercise that targets the rear delts and upper back. It involves raising the arms out to the sides while bent over.

title: Standing Calf Raise
description: Standing calf raises are a calf exercise that involves lifting the heels off the ground while standing. It targets the gastrocnemius muscles.

title: Lateral Raise
description: Lateral raises are a shoulder exercise that targets the side delts. It involves lifting the arms out to the sides while holding weights.

title: Leg Raise
description: The leg raise is an abdominal exercise that involves lying on the back and lifting the legs toward the ceiling. It targets the lower abs.

title: T-Bar Row
description: The T-bar row is a back exercise that involves lifting a loaded barbell while bent over at the hips. It targets the lats and middle back.

title: Box Squat
description: The box squat is a squat variation that involves sitting back onto a box or bench before standing back up. It targets the hips and glutes.

title: Medicine Ball Slam
description: The medicine ball slam is a full-body exercise that involves lifting a medicine ball overhead and forcefully slamming it to the ground. It is excellent for power and cardiovascular conditioning.

title: Chin-Up
description: A chin-up is an upper-body exercise where the body is pulled up using an overhand grip. It targets the back, biceps, and shoulders.

title: Plank Row
description: A plank row is a combination exercise that involves a plank position while performing rows with dumbbells. It targets the core and back muscles.

title: Bicycle Crunch
description: The bicycle crunch is a core exercise that involves a twisting motion, bringing the elbow toward the opposite knee in a bicycle-pedaling motion.

title: Seated Leg Press
description: The seated leg press is a machine-based exercise that targets the muscles of the lower body, including the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

title: Overhead Press
description: The overhead press is a compound exercise that involves pressing a weight overhead. It primarily targets the shoulders and triceps.

title: Romanian Deadlift
description: The Romanian deadlift is a variation of the deadlift that emphasizes the hamstrings and glutes. It involves hinging at the hips while keeping the legs relatively straight.

title: Dips
description: Dips are a compound exercise that targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps. They are performed by lowering and raising the body between parallel bars.

title: Box Jump
description: The box jump is a plyometric exercise that involves jumping onto a box or platform. It targets the lower body and improves explosive power.

title: Side Plank
description: The side plank is a core exercise that involves supporting the body on one arm and the side of the foot. It targets the obliques and improves core stability.

title: Cable Curl
description: The cable curl is a bicep exercise performed using a cable machine. It provides constant tension on the biceps throughout the range of motion.

title: Reverse Lunge
description: The reverse lunge is a lower-body exercise that involves stepping backward into a lunge position. It targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

title: Face Pull
description: The face pull is a shoulder exercise that targets the rear deltoids and upper traps. It is often performed using a cable machine with a rope attachment.

title: Burpee
description: The burpee is a full-body exercise that combines a squat, plank, push-up, and jump. It is an effective cardiovascular and strength-building exercise.

title: Leg Curl
description: The leg curl is an isolation exercise that targets the hamstrings. It is commonly performed on a machine where the heels are lifted toward the glutes.

title: Inverted Row
description: The inverted row is a bodyweight exercise that targets the muscles of the upper back. It is performed by pulling the body up to a bar while lying on the ground.

title: Skater Squat
description: The skater squat is a challenging single-leg exercise that targets the quadriceps and glutes. It involves squatting on one leg while extending the other leg backward.

title: Hollow Body Hold
description: The hollow body hold is a core exercise that involves lying on the back and lifting the legs and upper body off the ground, creating a 'hollow' position.

title: Seated Shoulder Press
description: The seated shoulder press is a variation of the overhead press performed while seated. It targets the shoulders and triceps.

title: Kettlebell Swing
description: The kettlebell swing is a dynamic exercise that targets the hips, glutes, and hamstrings. It involves swinging a kettlebell between the legs and then explosively swinging it upward.

title: Reverse Crunch
description: The reverse crunch is a core exercise that involves lifting the hips off the ground toward the chest. It targets the lower abdominal muscles.

title: Leg Raise
description: The leg raise is a core exercise that involves lying on the back and lifting the legs toward the ceiling. It targets the lower abdominal muscles.

title: Chest Press Machine
description: The chest press machine is a resistance machine that targets the chest muscles. It involves pushing weights forward while seated on the machine.

title: Single-Leg Deadlift
description: The single-leg deadlift is a balance and stability exercise that targets the hamstrings and glutes. It involves hinging at the hips while lifting one leg off the ground.

title: Dumbbell Renegade Row
description: The dumbbell renegade row is a full-body exercise that involves performing a row with dumbbells in a plank position. It targets the back, shoulders, and core.

title: Russian Twist
description: The Russian twist is a core exercise that involves rotating the torso from side to side while holding a weight or using bodyweight.

title: Medicine Ball Slam
description: The medicine ball slam is a power exercise that involves lifting a medicine ball overhead and forcefully slamming it onto the ground. It targets the entire body.

title: Lat Pulldown
description: The lat pulldown is a strength training exercise that targets the upper back. It involves pulling a bar or handle attachment down to the upper chest or behind the neck.

title: Walking Lunge
description: The walking lunge is a lower-body exercise that involves stepping forward into a lunge position and alternating legs. It targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

title: Bent Over Reverse Fly
description: The bent-over reverse fly is a back exercise that targets the rear deltoids and upper back. It is performed by bending over and lifting dumbbells to the sides.

title: Jumping Jacks
description: Jumping jacks are a cardiovascular exercise that involves jumping while spreading the legs and arms. They are effective for warming up the body and improving endurance.

title: Seated Leg Curl
description: The seated leg curl is a machine-based exercise that targets the hamstrings. It involves curling the legs toward the glutes while seated on the machine.

title: Battle Rope Waves
description: Battle rope waves are a high-intensity cardiovascular exercise that involves creating waves with heavy ropes. It targets the arms, shoulders, and core.

title: Pull-Up Bar Hang
description: The pull-up bar hang is a simple exercise that involves hanging from a pull-up bar. It helps improve grip strength and decompress the spine.

title: Leg Press Machine
description: The leg press machine is a resistance machine that targets the muscles of the lower body. It involves pushing a weight away from the body using the legs.

title: Dumbbell Side Lateral Raise
description: The dumbbell side lateral raise is a shoulder exercise that targets the lateral deltoids. It involves lifting dumbbells to the sides while keeping the arms straight.

title: Dumbbell Goblet Squat
description: The dumbbell goblet squat is a squat variation that involves holding a dumbbell at chest level. It targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

title: Boxing Jab Cross
description: The boxing jab cross is a cardiovascular exercise that simulates punching movements. It engages the arms, shoulders, and core while providing a cardio workout.

title: Seated Tricep Dip
description: The seated tricep dip is a tricep exercise performed on a bench or chair. It involves dipping the body downward to target the triceps.

title: Reverse Plank
description: The reverse plank is a core exercise that involves holding a plank position while facing upward. It targets the core and improves overall stability.

title: Dumbbell Front Raise
description: The dumbbell front raise is a shoulder exercise that targets the front deltoids. It involves lifting dumbbells to the front while keeping the arms straight.

title: Running
description: Running is a classic cardiovascular exercise that involves continuous forward motion at a moderate to high intensity. It improves cardiovascular health and burns calories.

title: Cycling
description: Cycling is a low-impact cardio exercise that can be done outdoors or on a stationary bike. It targets the lower body muscles and improves endurance.

title: Jump Rope
description: Jump rope is a high-intensity cardiovascular exercise that involves jumping over a rope repeatedly. It improves coordination, agility, and cardiovascular fitness.

title: Rowing
description: Rowing is a full-body cardio exercise that can be done on a rowing machine. It targets the back, legs, and arms while providing an effective cardiovascular workout.

title: Swimming
description: Swimming is a low-impact full-body workout that engages multiple muscle groups. It provides cardiovascular benefits and is easy on the joints.

title: Elliptical Training
description: Elliptical training is a low-impact cardio exercise that mimics the motion of running without the impact on joints. It targets the legs and arms.

title: Sprinting
description: Sprinting involves short bursts of maximum effort running. It is an excellent way to improve cardiovascular fitness, leg strength, and speed.

title: Mountain Climbers
description: Mountain climbers are a dynamic bodyweight exercise that involves bringing the knees toward the chest in a plank position. They provide a cardio challenge and engage the core.

title: Treadmill Incline Walking
description: Walking on a treadmill with an incline increases the intensity and engages the muscles in the legs and glutes. It's a lower-impact cardio option.

title: Stair Climbing
description: Stair climbing is a simple yet effective cardio exercise. It targets the legs and glutes while providing a cardiovascular workout.

title: Sled Push
description: The sled push is a strength and conditioning exercise where you push a weighted sled forward. It targets the legs, hips, and cardiovascular system.

title: Battle Rope Waves
description: Battle rope waves are a high-intensity cardiovascular exercise that involves creating waves with heavy ropes. It targets the arms, shoulders, and core.

title: Hiking
description: Hiking is an outdoor cardio activity that involves walking on trails or uneven terrain. It engages the legs, core, and provides a refreshing outdoor experience.

title: Box Jump
description: The box jump is a plyometric exercise that involves jumping onto a box or platform. It targets the lower body and improves explosive power.

title: Burpee
description: The burpee is a full-body exercise that combines a squat, plank, push-up, and jump. It is an effective cardiovascular and strength-building exercise.

title: Medicine Ball Slam
description: The medicine ball slam is a power exercise that involves lifting a medicine ball overhead and forcefully slamming it onto the ground. It targets the entire body.

title: Jumping Jacks
description: Jumping jacks are a cardiovascular exercise that involves jumping while spreading the legs and arms. They are effective for warming up the body and improving endurance.

title: Boxing Jab Cross
description: The boxing jab cross is a cardiovascular exercise that simulates punching movements. It engages the arms, shoulders, and core while providing a cardio workout.

title: Treadmill
description: Treadmill running or walking is a versatile cardio exercise that can be adjusted for speed and incline. It provides a controlled environment for cardiovascular training.
